definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Objective To observe the treatment effects of Naloxone in the patients of CO poisoning.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察纳络酮对一氧化碳中毒的治疗效果。

sentences.english: Finally, the map shows high carbon monoxide concentrations along the Atlantic Seaboard.
sentences.chinese: 最后，地图显示，亚特兰大海岸边一氧化碳浓度很高。

sentences.english: Watch of toxic eye ministry has carbon monoxide eye flesh is paralytic, cross sexual amaurosis .
sentences.chinese: 一氧化碳中毒眼部表现有眼肌麻痹，一过性黑朦。

sentences.english: The inflexion of carbon monoxide measures more big, body toxic extent more heavy.
sentences.chinese: 一氧化碳的吸入量越大，人中毒的程度就越重。

sentences.english: The major use of this spectrograph is to observe the CO molecular spectral lines from dark clouds in the Galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 主要用于南天暗星云中一氧化碳分子谱线的观测研究。

sentences.english: Carbon monoxide also results in systemic effects by reducing the oxygen-carrying capacity of the blood.
sentences.chinese: 通过减少血液载氧量，一氧化碳还导致全身效应。

sentences.english: Such relative people of carbon monoxide inhalation to a little less.
sentences.chinese: 这样相对人吸入的一氧化碳就要少一些。
一氧化碳中毒，马钱子碱，窒息。

sentences.english: Carbon monoxide and hydrogen cyanide are examples of chemical asphyxiants.
sentences.chinese: 一氧化碳和氰化氢的例子化学梗塞。

sentences.english: The reversibly adsorbed hydrogen is necessary for the formation of methanol.
sentences.chinese: 同时甲醇的生成是可逆吸附氢与一氧化碳作用的结果。

sentences.english: One of the constituents of both smoke and urban pollution is carbon monoxide.
sentences.chinese: 烟雾和城市污染物主要成分之一就是一氧化碳。

sentences.english: CO is not readily perceived by the human senses.
sentences.chinese: 一氧化碳不易被人的感觉器官所觉察。

sentences.english: An annual inspection can also reduce the risk of carbon-monoxide poisoning from furnaces.
sentences.chinese: 每年的安全检查也可以排除一氧化碳中毒的风险。

sentences.english: Fire can also cause burns and carbon monoxide poisoning when used in shelters.
sentences.chinese: 在庇护所内使用时，也会造成烧伤和一氧化碳中毒。

sentences.english: This will happen within two hours of breathing in this amount of carbon monoxide.
sentences.chinese: 这将发生在这两年内一氧化碳量的呼吸时间。

sentences.english: Carbon monoxide is definitely capable of impairing cardiovascular function.
sentences.chinese: 一氧化碳确实能损害心血管机能。
